    • plusDays

      public SimpleDate plusDays(long daysToAdd)
      Returns a copy of this SimpleDate with the specified number of days added. This method adds the specified amount to the days field incrementing the month and year fields as necessary to ensure the result remains valid. The result is only invalid if the maximum/minimum year is exceeded. For example, 2008-12-31 plus one day would result in 2009-01-01. This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.
      Parameters:
      daysToAdd - - the days to add, may be negative
      Returns:
      a LocalDate based on this date with the days added, not null

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks if this date is equal to another date. Only objects of type SimpleDate are compared, other types return false.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to check, null returns false
      Returns:
      true if this is equal to the other date

      public String toString()
      Outputs this date as a String, in the format of day/month/year.
